intro: Iranecio oligolepis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved iranecio, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Iran. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and small, clustered white or greenish flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils at high altitudes. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
